respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter a company of mutinous Citizens, with staves, clubs, and other weapons.

l.stage: Enter COMINIUS, TITUS LARTIUS, and other Senators; JUNIUS BRUTUS and SICINIUS VELUTUS.
Citizens steal away. Exeunt all but Sicinius and Brutus.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS and certain Senators.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: Rome. A room in Marcius' house.
Enter VOLUMNIA and VIRGILIA: they set them down on two low stools, and sew.

l.stage: Enter VALERIA, with an Usher and Gentlewoman.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter, with drum and colours, MARCIUS, TITUS LARTIUS, Captains and Soldiers. To them a Messenger.

l.stage: They sound a parley. Enter two Senators with others on the walls.
Enter the army of the Volsces.
Alarum. The Romans are beat back to their trenches.
Another alarum. The Volsces fly, and MARCIUS follows them to the gates.
Re-enter MARCIUS, bleeding, assaulted by the enemy.
They fight, and all enter the city.

sp.speaker: Third Roman
sp.stage: Enter MARCIUS and TITUS LARTIUS with a trumpet.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 6
div.stage: Enter COMINIUS, as it were in retire, with soldiers.

l.stage: They all shout and wave their swords, take him up in their arms, and cast up their caps.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 7
div.stage: TITUS LARTIUS, having set a guard upon Corioles, going with drum and trumpet toward COMINIUS and CAIUS MARCIUS, enters with a Lieutenant, other Soldiers, and a Scout.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 8
div.stage: Alarum as in battle. Enter, from opposite sides, MARCIUS and AUFIDIUS.

l.stage: They fight and certain Volsces come in the aid of Aufidius. Marcius fights till they be driven in breathless.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 9
div.stage: Flourish. Alarum. A retreat is sounded. Flourish.
Enter, from one side, COMINIUS with the Romans; from the other side, MARCIUS, with his arm in a scarf.

l.stage: Enter TITUS LARTIUS, with his power, from the pursuit.
A long flourish. They all cry âMarcius! Marcius!â cast up their caps and lances: Cominius and Lartius stand bare.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 10
div.stage: A flourish. Cornets. Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS, bloody, with two or three Soldiers.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter MENENIUS with the two Tribunes of the people, SICINIUS and BRUTUS.

l.stage: Enter COMINIUS the general, and TITUS LARTIUS; between them, CORIOLANUS, crowned with an oaken garland; with Captains and Soldiers, and a Herald.
Exeunt in state, as before. Brutus and Sicinius come forward.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter two Officers, to lay cushions.

sp.speaker: First Officer
sp.stage: A sennet. Enter, with Lictors before them, COMINIUS the consul, MENENIUS, CORIOLANUS, Senators, SICINIUS and BRUTUS. The Senators take their places; the Tribunes take their places by themselves. CORIOLANUS stands.

l.stage: Flourish of cornets. Exeunt all but Sicinius and Brutus.

sp.speaker: Citizen
sp.stage: Enter CORIOLANUS in a gown of humility, with MENENIUS.

sp.speaker: Coriolanus
sp.stage: Re-enter MENENIUS, with BRUTUS and SICINIUS.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Cornets. Enter CORIOLANUS, MENENIUS, all the Gentry, COMINIUS, TITUS LARTIUS, and other Senators.

l.stage: Enter a rabble of Citizens (Plebeians), with the AEdiles.
They all bustle about Coriolanus, crying
In this mutiny, the Tribunes, the AEdiles, and the People, are beat in.
Re-enter BRUTUS and SICINIUS, with the rabble.
Enter CORIOLANUS, MENENIUS, and COMINIUS, with Senators and Patricians.
Exeunt Coriolanus, Cominius, Menenius, Senators, and Patricians.
Shouting, and throwing up their caps.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: Rome. Before a gate of the city.
Enter CORIOLANUS, VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, MENENIUS, COMINIUS, with the young Nobility of Rome.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: The same. A street near the gate.
Enter SICINIUS, BRUTUS, and an AEdile.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 3
div.stage: A highway between Rome and Antium.
Enter a Roman and a Volsce, meeting.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter CORIOLANUS in mean apparel, disguised and muffled.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 5
div.stage: The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.

sp.speaker: Second Servingman
sp.stage: Enter a third Servingman. The first meets him.

sp.speaker: Coriolanus
sp.stage: Enter AUFIDIUS with the second Servingman.

l.stage: Exeunt Coriolanus and Aufidius. The two Servingmen come forward.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 7
div.stage: A camp, at a small distance from Rome.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter MENENIUS, COMINIUS, SICINUS, BRUTUS, and others.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: Entrance of the Volscian camp before Rome. Two Sentinels on guard.

l.stage: Enter, in mourning habits, VIRGILIA, VOLUMNIA, leading young MARCIUS, VALERIA, and Attendants.
He holds her by the hand, silent.
The Ladies make signs to Coriolanus.
Trumpets; hautboys; drums beat; all together.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 5
div.stage: The same. A street near the gate.
Enter two Senators with VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, VALERIA, c., passing over the stage, follomed by Patricians, and others.

l.stage: A flourish with drums and trumpets. Exeunt.
Enter three or four Conspirators of AUFIDIUs' faction.
Drums and trumpets sound, with great shouts of the People.
Enter the Lords of the city.
Enter CORIOLANUS, marching with drum and colours; Commoners being with him.
The Conspirators draw, and kill Coriolanus: Aufidius stands on his body.
Exeunt, bearing the body of Coriolanus. A dead march sounded.
